!SESSION ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 10, 2003 09:39:13.920 
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform: 
!STACK 
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException 
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) 
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) 
        at 
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) 
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) 
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:247) 
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703) 
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539) 
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Fatal Error: Unable to locate matching 
org.eclipse.core.runtime plugin. 
        at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.locateDefaultPlugins(PlatformConfiguration.java:2254) 
        at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.<init>(PlatformConfiguration.java:903) 
        at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.PlatformConfiguration.startup(PlatformConfiguration.java:1368) 
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.initialize(InternalBootLoader.java:582) 
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:989) 
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:838) 
        at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462) 
        ... 7 more 
 
Eclipse M3 build worked fine for me allong with all the other versions, however this version 
crashes with the above error.  I am running Mandrake Linux 9.0 with kde 3.1. I have tested it also  
on a mandrake 9 system with kde3.0 . Unfortunately I dont have any other linux versions to test it 
on.
*** Bug 31438 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Are you installing Eclipse into a directory with the same name? e.g. /home/eclipse
Or do you change the name everytime? e.g. /home/eclipse-m4, /home/eclipse-m5

What I did was that I moved the old version (build m3) into a directory called 
~ossidian/eclipse-bak. I then unziped the new version of eclipse (build m4), it  
unzipped into a directory called eclipse. I didn't overwrite the old version with the 
contents of the new zip. On the first run it started doing its install thing but then failed 
and produced the log message ( my first mail ) . 
 
--B

Zip the directory .metadata/.config and attaxch it to the bug.
Do you remember which version you were using ? 1126 or 1127 ?
Can you list the name of the directories under ~ossidian/eclipse-bak/features ?

Created an attachment (id=3401)
the metadata directory

Created an attachment (id=3402)
here is a listing of the files in the features directory
There is no .config directory under .metadata ?
Apologies, there is a .config directory but there is nothing in it.

Sorry Bryan but I will ask for more then :-)

can you attach the org.eclipse.core.boot/plugin.xml and boot.xml as well as the
org.eclipse.update.runtime/plugin.xml file ?
Also start eclipse with -debug and paste what is shown in the concole.

This situation usually (99%) occurs when eclipse reads a file called
.metadata/.config/platform.cfg which tells eclipse where to find the BOOT
plugin. Eclipse then attempts to load the runtime plugin (by looking at the
boot.xml file) and fails because the plugins are not compatible (boot and runtime)

It is very strange that in your case there is no platform.cfg file.... what is
the command line you use to start Eclipse ? The platform.cfg file should be in
your workspace. 

Starting eclipse with -debug will tell us which platform.cfg eclipse is using or
if it cannot find any. If it cannot find any it will attempt to create one...

Hi Bryan,
what command line do you use to start eclipse ?
what is in org.eclipse.core.runtime/plugin.xml ?

I just do the following to run eclipse 
cd ~ossidian/eclipse 
./eclipse

I have checked and there is no org.eclipse.core.runtime/plugin.xml file.  
Here are the contents of that directory   
[ossidian@bryannseries eclipse]$ ls -la ./plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime_2.1.0  
total 204  
drwxrwxr-x    2 ossidian ossidian     4096 Dec 18 18:29 ./  
drwxrwxr-x   63 ossidian ossidian     4096 Dec 18 18:40 ../  
-rw-rw-r--    1 ossidian ossidian   196608 Dec 18 18:29 runtime.jar

Your last update may be the reason. The startup looks for the plugin.xml of
runtime. Can you check the ZIP file again and make sure it is or it isn't inside
the ZIp/download?

I will download the M4 and M5 too... but right now I am stuck at 1% and it will
take me 5 hours to download :-(

The download definitely did not contain that file, I am in the process of downloading the new 
build ( M5 ) now to see if the problem is also present in it.

I am having some problems downloading eclipse M4 build, tried doing it last night but the 
eclipse download server was reporting internal server errors, strange ? Just a suggestion but 
most open source projects offer ftp downloads and md5 signature files to verify that the product 
has not been tampered with. Http isn't really ideal for a 64mb download. Just a thought. Anyhow 
I am downloading it again today, we have really crap bandwith in Ireland so this is a bit of a pain. 
 
--B
CC releng for FTP and Md5 checksum feature request

RelEng and our Infra crew are supposed to be working on FTP downloads.  I will 
ping them and find out what the hold up is?
Cool, ftp is a more efficient protocol as well. HTTP is far from ideal for large downloads.
So after all this discussion, is this still a blocker?

It certainly is a blocker as it is "blocking" me from even starting up eclipse. It just appears that 
there is an additional problem in that the download server is unreliable. 
 
--B
Bryan, are you able to download an M5 driver now ?

Our network is maxed out with a couple of other downloads at the moment, I will try 
downloading it a the end ot the day. 
 
--B

I have sucessfully downloaded the new eclipse m5 build via ftp. The new build appears to be 
working just fine. Also it is a big improvement to have ftp downloads on the site as http is not 
great for such large files. Thanks for all your help guys. I have changed the bug to fixed as the 
new build is working.
